context: The Estonian word 'tegema' is a verb that means 'to make' or 'to do'. It's one of the most frequently used verbs in Estonian and can be found in various contexts. In its basic form (infinitive), it appears as 'tegema'. When conjugated, it takes different forms: 'tegin' (I made/did), 'tegid' (you made/did), 'teeb' (he/she/it makes/does), etc. For example, 'Tegemist on ilusa p채evaga' means 'It is a beautiful day', where 'tegemist' comes from the verb 'tegema' and indicates 'the matter of'. In another context, 'Ma tegin hommikul voodi 채ra' means 'I made my bed this morning'.
